item.title: Removing large files from you git version control
item.description: While working with geodata, you might often end up downloading large raw-data files likes .shp that you will need in your data process chain. As you donâ€™t want to keep this static files under version control, you must tell git to ignore these files. Usually, you do it by adding a rule to your .gitignore file. But what if those files were created before there were added to the .gitignore ?
